paragraphs.zh-tw: You might be wondering why I'm wearing sunglasses, and one answer to that is, because I'm here to talk about glamour. So, we all think we know what glamour is. Here it is.
paragraphs.en: 你可能會疑惑為什麼我戴著太陽眼鏡 其中的一個答案就是因為我今天的主題是魅惑。 我們都以為自己知道魅惑是甚麼

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's glamorous movie stars, like Marlene Dietrich. And it comes in a male form, too -- very glamorous.
paragraphs.en: 一個魅力十足的電影巨星，就像 Marlene Dietrich 也有男性。 非常迷人。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Not only can he shoot, drive, drink -- you know, he drinks wine, there actually is a little wine in there -- and of course, always wears a tuxedo. But I think that glamour actually has a much broader meaning -- one that is true for the movie stars and the fictional characters, but also comes in other forms.
paragraphs.en: 不僅僅因為他可以射擊，開車-- 他也喝酒 照片裡也真的有酒 當然，他總是穿著燕尾服 但我認為，魅惑實際上有一個更廣泛的含義 不但實現在電影明星和虛構人物身上 但也出現在其他形式。

paragraphs.zh-tw: A magazine? Well, it's certainly not this one. This is the least glamorous magazine on the newsstand -- it's all about sex tips.
paragraphs.en: 一本雜誌？ 那麼，它肯定不是這一個。 這是報攤上最缺乏魅力的雜誌 - 全是性愛祕訣

paragraphs.zh-tw: Sex tips are not glamorous. And Drew Barrymore, for all her wonderful charm, is not glamorous either.
paragraphs.en: 性愛祕訣無關魅惑 和茱麗芭摩爾，雖然她很迷人 但那仍然不是魅力

paragraphs.zh-tw: But there is a glamour of industry. This is Margaret Bourke-White's -- one of her pictures she did.
paragraphs.en: 這個產業裡有一種特定的魅力 這是 Margaret Bourke White 所照的照片

paragraphs.zh-tw: Fantastic, glamorous pictures of steel mills and paper mills and all kinds of glamorous industrial places. And there's the mythic glamour of the garage entrepreneur.
paragraphs.en: 神奇，迷人的照片 鋼鐵廠和造紙廠和各種魅力的工業場所。 從車庫創業 也帶有一種神奇魅力

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is the Hewlett-Packard garage. We know everyone who starts a business in a garage ends up founding Hewlett-Packard.
paragraphs.en: 這是惠普車庫。 我們都知道誰從車庫開始創業 最終最後成立惠普。

paragraphs.zh-tw: There's the glamour of physics. What could be more glamorous than understanding the entire universe, grand unification? And, by the way, it helps if you're Brian Greene -- he has other kinds of glamour.
paragraphs.en: 有物理的魅惑 有什麼比了解整個宇宙更具魅惑呢 全體合一，如果你是 Brian Greene 更好 他擁有其他種類的魅力

paragraphs.zh-tw: And there is, of course, this glamour. This is very, very glamorous: the glamour of outer space -- and not the alien-style glamour, but the nice, clean, early '60s version.
paragraphs.en: 還有，當然，這種魅力 這是非常，非常迷人 - 太空的魅惑 不是外星人的魅惑 而是美觀大方，乾淨，60年代初的版本。

paragraphs.zh-tw: So what do we mean by glamour? Well, one thing you can do if you want to know what glamour means is you can look in the dictionary. And it actually helps a lot more if you look in a very old dictionary, in this case the 1913 dictionary.
paragraphs.en: 那麼，我們所說的魅惑究竟是甚麼 如果你想知道魅惑的意思 可以去查字典。 如果你看的是一本非常老的字典就更好了 在這種情況下，1913年的字典。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Because for centuries, glamour had a very particular meaning, and the word was actually used differently from the way we think of it. You had "a" glamour.
paragraphs.en: 因為數百年來，魅惑 (glamour) 有一個非常特別的意義， 我們使用它的方式和我們思考它的方式不同 你有魅力

paragraphs.zh-tw: It wasn't glamour as a quality -- you "cast a glamour." Glamour was a literal magic spell. Not a metaphorical one, the way we use it today, but a literal magic spell associated with witches and gypsies and to some extent, Celtic magic.
paragraphs.en: 這不只是一種質感 - 你還得使用它 魅惑就像是一種魔咒 不只是一種隱喻，像我們今日的用法 而是一種真的魔法，像巫婆和吉普賽人 並在一定程度上，凱爾特人魔術。

paragraphs.zh-tw: And over the years, around the turn of the 20th century, it started to take on this other kind of deception -- this definition for any artificial interest in, or association with, an object through which it appears delusively magnified or glorified. But still, glamour is an illusion.
paragraphs.en: 這些年來，在20世紀之交， 它開始帶著一種欺騙 像是對一個虛假的，不實放大或美化的物件 產生虛假的興趣或與其有關 但儘管如此，魅惑是一種錯覺。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Glamour is a magic spell. And there's something dangerous about glamour throughout most of history. When the witches cast a magic spell on you, it was not in your self-interest -- it was to get you to act against your interest.
paragraphs.en: 魅惑是一個神奇的咒語。 魅惑還有些危險 縱觀大部分的歷史，當女巫對你 施咒 那往往是與你心相悖的

paragraphs.zh-tw: Well of course, in the 20th century, glamour came to have this different meaning associated with Hollywood. And this is Hedy Lamarr.
paragraphs.en: 嗯，當然，在 20 世紀， 魅惑因為好萊塢有了全新的定義 這是 Hedy Lamarr

paragraphs.zh-tw: Hedy Lamarr said, "Anyone can look glamorous, all you have to do is sit there and look stupid." But in fact, with all due respect to Hedy -- about whom we'll hear more later -- there's a lot more to it. There was a tremendous amount of technical achievement associated with creating this Hollywood glamour.
paragraphs.en: 她說，"任何人都可以迷人 只要坐著裝笨就行了。" 我們稍後還會繼續提到 Hedy 和他的言論，與我們今天的主題息息相關 有許多驚人的科技發展 和創造這種好萊塢魅惑有關

paragraphs.zh-tw: There were scores of retouchers and lighting experts and make-up experts. You can go to the museum of Hollywood history in Hollywood and see Max Factor's special rooms that he painted different colors depending on the complexion of the star he was going to make up.
paragraphs.en: 有燈光師、化妝師和修片師 你可以到好萊塢歷史博物館 看看 Max Factor 為了不同膚色的明星 所設計的特殊房間，牆上的不同顏色

paragraphs.zh-tw: So you've got this highly stylized portrait of something that was not entirely of this earth -- it was a portrait of a star. And actually, we see glamorized photos of stars all the time -- they call them false color.
paragraphs.en: 於是你得到了這種高度設計的人像 不完全屬於這個地球，而是一張明星的相片 試試上，我們時常看見這些造假的魅惑巨星照 他們稱之為假彩色

paragraphs.zh-tw: Glamour is a form of falsification, but falsification to achieve a particular purpose. It may be to illuminate the star; it may be to sell a film.
paragraphs.en: 魅惑是一種形式的弄虛作假， 為達到某種特殊目的 可能是哄抬明星，或是為電影行銷

paragraphs.zh-tw: And it involves a great deal of technique. It's not -- glamour is not something -- you don't wake up in the morning glamorous. I don't care who you are.
paragraphs.en: 它涉及了大量的技術。 這不是 - 魅惑並不自然 無論你是誰，你都不會一醒來就如此具有魅力

paragraphs.zh-tw: Even Nicole Kidman doesn't wake up in the morning glamorous. There is a process of "idealization, glorification and dramatization," and it's not just the case for people.
paragraphs.en: 就算妮可基曼也不能 它總是要經過理想化，美化和戲劇化， 不只針對人物

paragraphs.zh-tw: Glamour doesn't have to be people. Architectural photography -- Julius Schulman, who has talked about transfiguration, took this fabulous, famous picture of the Kauffman House.
paragraphs.en: 魅力不只限於人物 建築攝影 - 討論變型的 Julius Schulman 照了這張著名的 Kauffman House 照

paragraphs.zh-tw: Architectural photography is extremely glamorous. It puts you into this special, special world.
paragraphs.en: 建築攝影是非常魅惑的 它讓你進入這個特別的世界

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is Alex Ross's comic book art, which appears to be extremely realistic, as part of his style is he gives you a kind of realism in his comic art. Except that light doesn't work this way in the real world.
paragraphs.en: 這是Alex Ross的漫畫 看上去非常真實 在他的漫畫中，他給了你一種真實感 但真實世界的燈光並不實這樣

paragraphs.zh-tw: When you stack people in rows, the ones in the background look smaller than the ones in the foreground -- but not in the world of glamour. What glamour is all about -- I took this from a blurb in the table of contents of New York magazine, which was telling us that glamour is back -- glamour is all about transcending the everyday.
paragraphs.en: 當你把人排成一排 後面的人看上去應該比前面的人小 但在魅惑世界不是這樣 魅惑是怎麼一回事 我在紐約一本雜誌的的目錄裡看見這個 告訴我們魅惑回來了 魅惑超越日常生活

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I think that that's starting to get at what the core that combines all sorts of glamour is. This is Filippino Lippi's 1543 portrait of Saint Apollonia.
paragraphs.en: 我認為這已經幾乎達到 結合所有魅惑的核心了 這是 Fiilippino Lippi 1543年所繪的聖徒 Apollonia 相

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I don't know who she is either, but this is the [16th] century equivalent of a supermodel. It's a very glamorous portrait.
paragraphs.en: 我也不知道她是誰 在15世紀大概相當與今日的名模 一幅非常魅惑的畫像

paragraphs.zh-tw: Why is it glamorous? It's glamorous, first, because she is beautiful -- but that does not make you glamorous, that only makes you beautiful. She is graceful, she is mysterious and she is transcendent, and those are the central qualities of glamour.
paragraphs.en: 魅惑在哪？ 魅惑，第一因為她美麗 但這不足以讓你魅惑他人 只有讓你美麗。 她優雅，她是神秘的，她是超越性， 這些都是魅惑的基本要素

paragraphs.zh-tw: You don't see her eyes; they're looking downward. She's not looking away from you exactly, but you have to mentally imagine her world.
paragraphs.en: 你看不見她的眼睛，她垂下眼 她並不是不看你 但你必須自己想像她的世界

paragraphs.zh-tw: She's encouraging you to contemplate this higher world to which she belongs, where she can be completely tranquil while holding the iron instruments of her death by torture. Mel Gibson's "Passion Of The Christ" -- not glamorous.
paragraphs.en: 她的鼓勵你去思考這個更高的層次 她在那裡全然安靜 手持折磨她致死的鐵器 梅爾吉勃遜的“基督受難記” - 不魅惑

paragraphs.zh-tw: That's glamour: that's Michelangelo's "Pieta," where Mary is the same age as Jesus and they're both awfully happy and pleasant. Glamour invites us to live in a different world.
paragraphs.en: 這才是魅惑 這是米開朗基羅的“聖母憐子圖”，其中瑪麗和耶穌童年 他們倆如此幸福愉快 魅惑讓我們活在不同世界

paragraphs.zh-tw: It has to simultaneously be mysterious, a little bit distant -- that's why, often in these glamour shots, the person is not looking at the audience, it's why sunglasses are glamorous -- but also not so far above us that we can't identify with the person. In some sense, there has to be something like us.
paragraphs.en: 它又神祕又遙遠 這就是為甚麼在這些魅惑的相片中 他們從不直視觀眾 這就是為甚麼太陽眼鏡如此魅惑 但又不至於讓我們認不出那人 從某種意義上說，它必須和我們有些共通處

paragraphs.zh-tw: So as I say, in religious art, you know, God is not glamorous. God cannot be glamorous because God is omnipotent, omniscient -- too far above us.
paragraphs.en: 因此，正如我說，在宗教藝術，你知道，神是不魅惑的 神不迷人因為祂無所不在 無所不知 - 這有些太遙遠了

paragraphs.zh-tw: And yet you will see in religious art, saints or the Virgin Mary will often be portrayed -- not always -- in glamorous forms. As I said earlier, glamour does not have to be about people, but it has to have this transcendent quality.
paragraphs.en: 然而，你會看到在宗教藝術，聖人或聖母瑪利亞 往往被描繪 - 並不總是 - 用一種魅惑的方式 正如我剛才所說，魅惑不一定和觀眾有關 但必須有一種穿透性

paragraphs.zh-tw: What is it about Superman? Aside from Alex Ross's style, which is very glamorous, one thing about Superman is he makes you believe that a man can fly. Glamour is all about transcending this world and getting to an idealized, perfect place.
paragraphs.en: 超人呢？ 除了來自 Alex Ross 的魅惑風格 超人讓你相信人可以飛 魅惑有關超越這個世界 到一個理想的，完美的地方

paragraphs.zh-tw: And this is one reason that modes of transportation tend to be extremely glamorous. The less experience we have with them, the more glamorous they are.
paragraphs.en: 這也是為甚麼運輸系統 總是非常魅惑 我們越不曾經歷的 越魅惑

paragraphs.zh-tw: So you can do a glamorized picture of a car, but you can't do a glamorized picture of traffic. You can do a glamorized picture of an airplane, but not the inside.
paragraphs.en: 你可以做一個魅惑的車照 但你不能做出一張魅惑的塞車照 你可以做一張魅惑的飛機相片，但不包括內部

paragraphs.zh-tw: The notion is that it's going to transport you, and the story is not about, you know, the guy in front of you in the airplane, who has this nasty little kid, or the big cough. The story is about where you're arriving, or thinking about where you're arriving.
paragraphs.en: 那概念是：它會帶你到其它地方 這和坐你前面的那傢伙無關 和這個討厭的小孩是誰的，或大聲咳嗽無關 這故事和你的目的地有關 或想像你的目的地

paragraphs.zh-tw: And this sense of being transported is one reason that we have glamour styling. This sort of streamlining styling is not just glamorous because we associate it with movies of that period, but because, in it's streamlining, it transports us from the everyday.
paragraphs.en: 這種被帶走的感覺 就是魅惑風格的來源 這些線條並不只是魅惑 不只因為我們會因此想到同期的電影 而是在這些線條中，我們忘記了日常生活

paragraphs.zh-tw: The same thing -- arches are very glamorous. Arches with stained glass -- even more glamorous.
paragraphs.en: 相同的，拱門很魅惑 拱門和彩色玻璃，更魅惑

paragraphs.zh-tw: Staircases that curve away from you are glamorous. I happen to find that particular staircase picture very glamorous because, to me, it captures the whole promise of the academic contemplative life -- but maybe that's because I went to Princeton.
paragraphs.en: 旋轉樓梯非常魅惑 某些樓梯圖片對我來說非常魅惑 因為對我來說，它就像在承諾我 一個學術的、深思的生活 但也許那是因為我去了普林斯頓大學。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Anyway, skylines are super glamorous, city streets -- not so glamorous. You know, when you get, actually to this town it has reality.
paragraphs.en: 天際線非常魅惑 街道 － 沒這麼魅惑 你知道的，真實並不魅惑

paragraphs.zh-tw: The horizon, the open road, is very, very glamorous. There are few things more glamorous than the horizon -- except, possibly, multiple horizons.
paragraphs.en: 地平線上，在開闊的道路，是非常，非常魅惑 很少有甚麼事情比地平線更魅惑 除了多重的地平線

paragraphs.zh-tw: Of course, here you don't feel the cold, or the heat -- you just see the possibilities. In order to pull glamour off, you need this Renaissance quality of sprezzatura, which is a term coined by Castiglione in his book, "The Book Of The Courtier." There's the not-glamorous version of what it looks like today, after a few centuries.
paragraphs.en: 當然，在這裡你不覺得冷，或熱 - 你看到的只是可能性 想要達到魅惑的效果，你需要文藝復興的質感 Castiglione 在它的“朝臣書”中 創造了 sprezzatura 這個詞 經過幾個世紀，這本書今日 看上去不再魅惑

paragraphs.zh-tw: And sprezzatura is the art that conceals art. It makes things look effortless.
paragraphs.en: sprezzatura 是一種隱藏的藝術。 它使事情看起來不費吹灰之力。

paragraphs.zh-tw: You don't think about how Nicole Kidman is maneuvering that dress -- she just looks completely natural. And I remember reading, after the Lara Croft movies, how Angelina Jolie would go home completely black and blue.
paragraphs.en: 你不想知道妮可基曼如何努力套進那件禮服 她看上去非常自然舒服 裘莉在拍攝古墓奇兵期間 打的全身是傷，滿身的瘀青

paragraphs.zh-tw: Of course, they covered that with make-up, because Lara Croft did all those same stunts -- but she doesn't get black and blue, because she has sprezzatura. "To conceal all art and make whatever is done or said appear to be without effort": And this is one of the critical aspects of glamour.
paragraphs.en: 但當然他們都用化妝掩蓋了 因為女主角做了所有的動作 卻毫無瘀青，因為她有 sprezzatura 掩蓋所有的努力，看上去毫不費力 事實上，這是魅惑的一個重點

paragraphs.zh-tw: Glamour is about editing. How do you create the sense of transcendence, the sense of evoking a perfect world? The sense of, you know, life could be better, I could join this -- I could be a perfect person, I could join this perfect world.
paragraphs.en: 魅力是有關編輯。 妮如果創造穿透力 喚起一個完美世界 生活可以更好，我可以加入它們 我可以是一個完美的人，加入這個完美的世界。

paragraphs.zh-tw: We don't tell you all the grubby details. Now, this was kindly lent to me by Jeff Bezos, from last year.
paragraphs.en: 我們不告訴你任何骯髒的細節。 這是 Jeff Bezos 好心借我的

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is underneath Jeff's desk. This is what the real world of computers, lamps, electrical appliances of all kinds, looks like.
paragraphs.en: 這是傑夫辦公桌下面的模樣 這是現實世界的電腦， 燈具，電器的各種模樣。

paragraphs.zh-tw: But if you look in a catalog -- particularly a catalog of modern, beautiful objects for your home -- it looks like this. There are no cords.
paragraphs.en: 但如果你看今天目錄 - 在你為你的家找尋一個現代的、美麗的傢具時 它看起來像這樣。 沒有電線。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Look next time you get these catalogs in your mail -- you can usually figure out where they hid the cord. But there's always this illusion that if you buy this lamp, you will live in a world without cords.
paragraphs.en: 下次當你收到這些目錄時 你可以想像他們都把線藏到哪裡去了 但你總是有這種幻覺：如果你買了這盞燈 你將活在一個沒有電線的世界

paragraphs.zh-tw: And the same thing is true of, if you buy this laptop or you buy this computer -- and even in these wireless eras, you don't get to live in the world without cords. You have to have mystery and you have to have grace.
paragraphs.en: 如果你買了這台筆記本電腦 或者是這台電腦 - 甚至在這個無線時代 你仍然無法活在無線的世界 你必須有神祕，和風度

paragraphs.zh-tw: And there she is -- Grace. This is the most glamorous picture, I think, ever.
paragraphs.en: 就像她一樣 － 葛雷斯。 我想這將永遠會是史上最魅惑的照片

paragraphs.zh-tw: Part of the thing is that, in "Rear Window," the question is, is she too glamorous to live in his world? And the answer is no, but of course it's really just a movie. Here's Hedy Lamarr again.
paragraphs.en: 還有在電影”後窗“的那些鏡頭 問題是，她是否魅惑到一個不屬於他的世界？ 答案是否定的，當然那只是一部電影 Hedy Lamarr 又來了

paragraphs.zh-tw: And, you know, this kind of head covering is extremely glamorous because, like sunglasses, it conceals and reveals at the same time. Translucence is glamorous -- that's why all these people wear pearls.
paragraphs.en: 你知道這種頭套非常魅惑 它就像太陽眼鏡，它隱藏又顯示⋯⋯ 半透明的魅惑 於是人們戴珍珠

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's why barware is glamorous. Glamour is translucent -- not transparent, not opaque. It invites us into the world but it doesn't give us a completely clear picture.
paragraphs.en: 這就是為什麼酒具如此魅惑 - 魅惑是半透明的， 不透明，也不完全不透明 它邀請我們進入 但我們並不知道它的全貌

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I think if Grace Kelly is the most glamorous person, maybe a spiral staircase with glass block may be the most glamorous interior shot, because a spiral staircase is incredibly glamorous. It has that sense of going up and away, and yet you never think about how you would really trip if you were -- particularly going down.
paragraphs.en: 如果葛雷斯凱莉是最為魅惑的人 或許玻璃製的旋轉樓梯是最魅惑的室內照 因為螺旋樓梯非常魅惑 它暗示著走上去，離開 但你從未想到下來的時候 很容易跌倒

paragraphs.zh-tw: And of course glass block has that sense of translucence. So, this session's supposed to be about pure pleasure but glamour's really partly about meaning.
paragraphs.en: 當然玻璃有一種透明感 這次的會議討論的應該是純粹的享樂 但魅惑其實有它真正的意義

paragraphs.zh-tw: All individuals and all cultures have ideals that cannot possibly be realized in reality. They have contradictions, they uphold principles that are incommensurable with each other -- whatever it is -- and yet these ideals give meaning and purpose to our lives as cultures and as individuals.
paragraphs.en: 所以人和所有文化都有 無法實現的理想 他們有矛盾， 它們有些無法互通的原則 無論如何，但這些理想為我們的文化和個人生活 帶來意義和目的

paragraphs.zh-tw: And the way we deal with that is we displace them -- we put them into a golden world, an imagined world, an age of heroes, the world to come. And in the life of an individual, we often associate that with some object.
paragraphs.en: 我們處理它的方式是 把它放到一個想像的，金色的世界 一個英雄的時代，即將出現的理想世界 我們把這些理想和某些物品做出聯繫

paragraphs.zh-tw: The white picket fence, the perfect house. The perfect kitchen -- no bills on the counter in the perfect kitchen.
paragraphs.en: 白色的柵欄，完美的房子。 完美的廚房 - 桌上沒有任何賬單的完美廚房

paragraphs.zh-tw: You know, you buy that Viking range, this is what your kitchen will look like. The perfect love life -- symbolized by the perfect necklace, the perfect diamond ring.
paragraphs.en: 如果你買下那名牌烤箱，你的廚房就會變成這樣 完美的項鍊象徵完美的愛情 完美的鑽戒

paragraphs.zh-tw: The perfect getaway in your perfect car. This is an interior design firm that is literally called Utopia.
paragraphs.en: 在完美的車裡開往完美假期 這是一個室內設計公司，名字就叫烏托邦

paragraphs.zh-tw: The perfect office -- again, no cords, as far as I can tell. And certainly, no, it doesn't look a thing like my office.
paragraphs.en: 完美的辦公室 同樣，沒有電線， 當然，我的辦公室看起來根本不是這樣

paragraphs.zh-tw: I mean, there's no paper on the desk. We want this golden world.
paragraphs.en: 桌上連張紙都沒有 我們要這個金色的世界

paragraphs.zh-tw: And some people get rich enough, and if they have their ideals -- in a sort of domestic sense, they get to acquire their perfect world. Dean Koontz built this fabulous home theater, which is -- I don't think accidentally -- in Art Deco style.
paragraphs.en: 某些人賺夠了錢 如果它們有自己的家居理想的話 他們可以買到這個完美世界 Dean Koontz 蓋了這個裝置藝術風格的家庭影院 我認為絕非碰巧

paragraphs.zh-tw: That symbolizes this sense of being safe and at home. This is not always good, because what is your perfect world? What is your ideal, and also, what has been edited out? Is it something important? "The Matrix" is a movie that is all about glamour.
paragraphs.en: 象徵著安全和居家 這不一定總是件好事，你的完美世界是怎樣的 你的理想世界是怎樣的？在那其中 你是否剪掉了甚麼重要的細節？ 駭客任務是一部有關魅惑的電影

paragraphs.zh-tw: I could do a whole talk on "The Matrix" and glamour. It was criticized for glamorizing violence, because, look -- sunglasses and those long coats, and, of course, they could walk up walls and do all these kinds of things that are impossible in the real world.
paragraphs.en: 這個演講可以全部拿來討論駭客任務和魅惑 但是你知道，它被批評為渲染暴力 你看看那些太陽眼鏡和長大衣 他們還可以飛簷走壁之類的 在真實世界中是不可能的

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is another Margaret Bourke-White photo. This is from Soviet Union. Attractive.
paragraphs.en: 這是另一張 Margaret Bourke White 的照片 蘇聯。很吸引人。

paragraphs.zh-tw: I mean, look how happy the people are, and good-looking too. You know, we're marching toward Utopia.
paragraphs.en: 看看他們多麼開心，和美麗。 我們正邁向烏托邦

paragraphs.zh-tw: I'm not a fan of PETA, but I think this is a great ad. Because what they're doing is they're saying, your coat's not so glamorous, what's been edited out is something important.
paragraphs.en: 我不是保護動物組織的成員，但我覺得這是個很好的廣告 因為他們在說的是 你的外套並不這麼魅惑，有些重要的事情被除去了

paragraphs.zh-tw: But actually, what's even more important than remembering what's been edited out is thinking, are the ideals good? Because glamour can be very totalitarian and deceptive. And it's not just a matter of glamorizing cleaning your floor.
paragraphs.en: 事實上，有甚麼比思考甚麼被除去了 更重要，更理想？ 由於魅惑可以非常極權和騙人。 這不只是美化你的地板

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is from "Triumph Of The Will" -- brilliant editing to cut together things. There's a glamour shot.
paragraphs.en: 這是“意志的勝利” 把所有東西精緻地消滅掉 有一幅魅惑的照片

paragraphs.zh-tw: National Socialism is all about glamour. It was a very aesthetic ideology.
paragraphs.en: 國家社會主義總是極為魅惑 是一種理想美感

paragraphs.zh-tw: It was all about cleaning up Germany, and the West, and the world, and ridding it of anything unglamorous. So glamour can be dangerous.
paragraphs.en: 有關清理德國，西方和世界 和消除任何不魅惑的事物 魅惑可能是危險的

paragraphs.zh-tw: I think glamour has a genuine appeal, has a genuine value. I'm not against glamour.
paragraphs.en: 魅惑當然是吸引人的，有它的價值 我並不反對魅惑

paragraphs.zh-tw: But there's a kind of wonder in the stuff that gets edited away in the cords of life. And there is both a way to avoid the dangers of glamour and a way to broaden your appreciation of it.
paragraphs.en: 但在日常生活中，那些被捨棄的東西裡，有些甚麼重要的事 有一種方法可以避開魅惑的危險 或拓展你對魅惑的讚賞

paragraphs.zh-tw: And that's to take Isaac Mizrahi's advice and confront the manipulation of it all, and sort of admit that manipulation is something that we enjoy, but also enjoy how it happens. And here's Hedy Lamarr.
paragraphs.en: 採用 Issac Mizrahi 的堅毅 對面操控的事實 並承認我們喜歡這種操作 享受它是如何發生的 Hedy Lamarr 在此

paragraphs.zh-tw: She's very glamorous but, you know, she invented spread-spectrum technology. So she's even more glamorous if you know that she really wasn't stupid, even though she thought she could look stupid.
paragraphs.en: 她非常迷人，但你同時知道她發明了擴頻技術 知道她不傻，讓她更迷人了 儘管她知道她可能看上去很傻

paragraphs.zh-tw: David Hockney talks about how the appreciation of this very glamorous painting is heightened if you think about the fact that it takes two weeks to paint this splash, which only took a fraction of a second to happen. There is a book out in the bookstore -- it's called "Symphony In Steel," and it's about the stuff that's hidden under the skin of the Disney Center.
paragraphs.en: David Hockney 談到如何欣賞這點 我認為，那些魅惑的畫將更迷人 如果你想到它需要兩週才能完成 但其實一切在一秒內都已發生 書店裡有本書 叫“鋼的交響曲” 有關迪士尼中心外表下的一切

paragraphs.zh-tw: And that has a fascination. It's not necessarily glamorous, but unveiling the glamour has an appeal.
paragraphs.en: 它很神奇 或許不魅惑，但揭開魅惑的表面也有其魅力

paragraphs.zh-tw: There's a wonderful book called "Crowns" that's all these glamour pictures of black women in their church hats. And there's a quote from one of these women, and she talks about, "As a little girl, I'd admire women at church with beautiful hats.
paragraphs.en: 有本好書叫“冠” 有許多黑人婦女戴著教會帽的迷人照片 其中有個婦女說 “在我還是一個小女孩的時候，我就喜歡教堂裡的這些漂亮帽子

paragraphs.zh-tw: They looked like beautiful dolls, like they'd just stepped out of a magazine. But I also knew how hard they worked all week.
paragraphs.en: 他們看上去像美麗的娃娃，像從雜誌中走出來的 但我也知道他們努力工作了一週

paragraphs.zh-tw: Sometimes under those hats there's a lot of joy and a lot of sorrow." And, actually, you get more appreciation for glamour when you realize what went into creating it. Thank you.
paragraphs.en: 在這些帽子下有很多很多的快樂和悲傷。 你更能欣賞這些魅惑 當你了解人們花了多少心思創造它 謝謝。
